title: Boy Scouts Win Over More Abuse Survivors For $2.7 Billion Bankruptcy Deal
sub_head: Youth group’s restructuring plan nets support of nearly 86% of ballots cast, exceeding self-imposed threshold
body:
An additional 9,000 individuals claiming they were sexually abused while in the Boy Scouts of America voted in favor of a $2.7 billion compensation plan, pushing support for it to nearly 86% of all ballots cast ahead of a bankruptcy-court trial next week.
The additional votes among the roughly 82,200 individuals who have filed sexual-abuse claims against the youth group increase its chances of winning approval for the settlement from Judge Laurie Selber Silverstein of the U.S. Bankruptcy Court in Wilmington, Del., at a trial scheduled to begin Monday.
